channel.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
channel.description:
This is probably a noobish question. I have a 317. In npc.cfg I have:
[code] npc = 2697 Corporal Beast 785 2000 [/code]
You see, the Corp should have 2k HP. However, when I attack him, he only has 208 HP. Is a HP cap blocking this? I feel like a noob not figuring this out. >=(

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

I don’t know if that worked or not - I switched to a client that doesn’t have HP left / max hp over the health bar. I guess it worked - as he takes forever to kill, and you can’t solo him.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Umm, i believe the 2nd number is the HP, for a normal base at least. Try the 1st number and see what happens.

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

AHA! I just found out something. I changed to HP in npc.cfg to ‘1’ to see if there was indeed a cap. However, the HP now reads 208/1. Hmmm… Conflicting IDs maybe? It could be pulling another HP level if something conflicted.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

Read it. Good news: I got him to hit (really) hard on players. Still working on the HP problem though. I will try a few more things, then I might review what you offered me.

I am starting to think there is a HP cap somewhere, as I had it set to heal to 2k HP each time he uses a melee attack, and it just goes to 208…

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

It is using autospawn. It’s just acting like I used the ::npc command (doesn’t obey timers and such)

Code I have:

spawn = 2697	2967	3819	0	2962	3817	3819	2969	1	Corporal Beast

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

Know what else I just realized? When I kill the corp he doesn’t obey the respawn timer (repawns instantly), and doesn’t re-spawn and his spawn cords… He re-appears right in front of me.

So something must be wrong. I even added some if()'s in the respawn code to check if the ID of the respawning monster, and if it is the corp make sure his HP is 2k. If the respawn code isn’t being run through when he dies, it would explain the other issues I think.

@lorenso; I sent you a PM.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @lorenso lorenso
item.description:
@lorenso wrote:

[quote=“Wiplayer, post:10, topic:309578”]I can send my npc.cfg file if someone want’s to check tabbing. My editor sometimes fails at what it does. Everything in there is tabbed. This is just so weird. I think there might be a HP cap somewhere, but I wouldn’t know where to look. I couldn’t find a HP cap in NPCHandler, so…

=S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2009, 11:28:44 am[/size][hr]Oh, and this is what I have in Class5.java on my client…

if(i == 2697) { // NPC ID you can change this if u like aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses int changedColors = 1; // Number of model colors changed on the NPC class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray76[0] = 0; // Original model color class5.anIntArray70[0] = 0; // Changed model color class5.anIntArray94[0] = 9389; // 28002 class5.aString65 = "Corporal Beast"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = 982; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "The Corporal Beast! OH NO!".getBytes(); // NPC description } [/quote]
Pm me the npc.cfg, i will see what i can.

Read full topic
item.source: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

I can send my npc.cfg file if someone want’s to check tabbing. My editor sometimes fails at what it does. Everything in there is tabbed. This is just so weird. I think there might be a HP cap somewhere, but I wouldn’t know where to look. I couldn’t find a HP cap in NPCHandler, so…

=S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2009, 11:28:44 am[/size][hr]Oh, and this is what I have in Class5.java on my client…

if(i == 2697) { // NPC ID you can change this if u like
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack";
    class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses
    int changedColors = 1; // Number of model colors changed on the NPC
    class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors];
    class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors];
    class5.anIntArray76[0] = 0; // Original model color
    class5.anIntArray70[0] = 0; // Changed model color
    class5.anIntArray94[0] = 9389; // 28002
    class5.aString65 = "Corporal Beast"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = 982; //combat level
    class5.aByteArray89 = "The Corporal Beast! OH NO!".getBytes(); // NPC description
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

Still doesn’t work. Odd. I have maker-over_mage as 599 by the way.

In autospawn:

spawn = 2697	2962	3819	0	2962	3819	3819	2962	1	Corporal Beast

In NPC.cfg:

npc = 2697	     Corporal Beast		982	2000	100

This is so weird -.-

item.title: NPC HP is not what it is in npc.cfg
item.dc:creator: @lorenso lorenso
item.description:
@lorenso wrote:

Tested, and works:Open up npc.CFG then search for:npc = 2676 Make-over_mage 0 0 Under that add:npc = 2697 Corporal Beast 982 2000 100
Tested and it worked. I hope it works for you too. Good luck!

Read full topic
